Reviews.Title: “Not a very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: pjo1923
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and the ambience is less than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: JDwalkabout
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, half the price of the hotel next door...(which i stayed at last time in Singapore) but you get what you pay for.. In dire need of a facelift (no change in the 5 years since i stayed here last)...but functional for short stays...the Robertson Quay Hotel is cheap, in a prime position, but dont expect much and you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesF_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the heart of the tourist area within walking distance of Clark Quay and Boat Quay. It is also only a short walk to Chinatown for the best value food and drink. We satyed twice - both out and back from Thailand for stopovers and found the location perfect. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast was good and plentiful with no restriction on what you had. Rooms were small but OK and decent value given the prices in Singapore. We used the train from the airport but it was easier to use taxi (18S$) for the return airport trip..

Reviews.Title: “My home in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: chowchow23
Reviews.Content: I had selected Robertson Quay Hotel by chance for my first time in Singapore years ago. Since then I've always returned because I find what I need in this pricey city with its hot climate: location, pool, comfortable bed and quite affordable price. It's very true that the hotel deadly needs a renovation. Rooms are tiny but again, the bed is comfortable, and we can enjoy large views of the skyline and green space. TV programs aren't bad. I've seen tinier rooms in Hong Kong. What is special is the bathroom. It is the smallest I've ever seen. First time visitors, be ready to that. Yet there is still a WC, a sink and a shower with a curtain. The swimming pool is at the 4th floor if I remember. Yes this is small but you can have it just for yourself most of the time. Use the heavy waterfall to massage your back! If your room is nearby you can walk directly to/from the pool. Very cool, isn't it? The reception is, well, not the warmest in the world. Nothing to complain about, though. The buffet breakfast is the same every morning but you'll be full before leaving the hotel. The dining room is pretty pleasant and bright. It is also possible to eat outside. The location is the big plus of the hotel, just near Clarke Quay and in front of the river. Numerous restaurants and bars are nearby. This is where people go to chill out night time and during the week-end. No need to take taxi or MRT after dinner, just a 5 min walk. Clarke Quay MRT is nearby. You can even walk until the Merlion through Boat Quay. If you like food courts, the Maxwell Food Centre in Chinatown (with its famous Tian Tian Chicken Rice) is at 5 min by taxi. I wish there was free wifi Internet in the hotel, but this is Singapore, nothing is free ...

Reviews.Title: “Most unwelcoming”
Reviews.Author: Ahmod
Reviews.Content: I arrived 11am. So I was told to put my suitcase in an open space and to come back at 2pm, and "your credit card for o verification". This is a summary of the service level. The no service breakfast is ok for 3 days, then you realize the very limited choice. The hotel is lodging hookers and ladyboys who propose their services in the elevator. One of the most uncharming hotels I ever entered.

Reviews.Title: “TLC required”
Reviews.Author: KURIPOT45
Reviews.Content: In line with other reviews here the hotel could do with a facelift. It was however in a good central location and the MRT just a few minutes stroll away. Although the rooms are small they are adequate for an overnight stop over and no worse than many city centre hotels I have used worldwide. Breakfast was better than expected and I did manage a good night's sleep. On the whole I would use again

Reviews.Title: “In serious need of a make over”
Reviews.Author: Buick54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. We chose it because of it's location close to Clark Quay and the hotel being on the river edge. And because it's probably the cheapest hotel in the area. From previous reviews we wen't expecting much and it pretty much lived up to others reviews. The hotel is showing it's age and needs renovation. Not that it was dirty, just run down. OK for us I suppose because we just wanted a basic hotel in that area ---- and we got it. The rooms are of the size you would expect and nowhere to put / hang your clothes except on the window ledge. The bathroom is tiny and you can't swing a cat. There is no exhaust fan in there -- it's outside the door. Not much use when you want to use the toilet. The sheets were changed daily which was a surprise. The hotel style is circular built in the atrium model. Thus it's very noisy as noise echoes throughout , especially will people slamming doors. Also there are no smoking floors which really are useless because smoke can enter the open atrium and filter everywhere. Breakfast is VERY basic and the choices do not alter from day to day. Would we stay there again ? Maybe, only after investigating all other hotel options ( which are very expensive in Singapore ) Could I recommend others to stay there --- probably not. Shop around and do your homework.

Reviews.Title: “The Key to Quay”
Reviews.Author: honeylegs
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. If you like going out at night then the riverside bars and joints are just a few meters away.... walking distance from this hotel. People walk in Singapore and when I say walk i mean really walk and walk.... :-) Orchard road is just 3-4 Singapore blocks away. Breakfast is practically the same every morning. The pool is small. The rooms are tiny..... Singapore standard rooms I guess. But the big plus is..... from our 10th floor room we had a great view of the famous Marina Bay Sands Hotel and the big pool of the neighboring hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: rishin11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place last week. Hotel service was good. We were allowed early check-in on request. Got a twin room as there was no other room left. It was not difficult to bring the two beds together. The bathroom was small - just had standing room. There were many patches of mould. Otherwise the room was clean. Breakfast was included in our stay. It had a wide variety of options. The other reviews have said it correctly that the location is great but the hotel is bit worn out. It needs revamp. About 10 min from Clarke Quay MRT and the action/party.

Reviews.Title: “Super location a bit worn down hotel”
Reviews.Author: David_Bergman
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for and this is market standard in Singapore. We did not want to spend too much money on hotel and focused on location. This hotel has a great location and very easy access to Singapore and fantastic restaurants just minutes from the hotel. Rooms are very small and we choose two rooms with connecting doors and the kids (5 and 7) slept in one room and me and my wife in the other. Breakfast was better then I had expected. Aircon did not work in one of the rooms when we arrived but maintenance took care of that while we had dinner at a restaurant nearby. Friendly and nice staff! If you are on a budget and want a nice location in a vibrant city this hotel is very good. If you are looking at spending a lot of time in the hotel and want a nice pool do not choose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redsp3rrow
Reviews.Content: The room is shabby and very very small. Worst hotel I've ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: Cram987
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Rooms are small (not tiny), hotel is a little old and in need of renovation, but everything works. The room was spotlessly clean. Staff generally friendly. Location is superb. Would stay again and happy to recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tarunmanchanda
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location with limited budget, consider this. You have to compromise on certain aspects like room size, but we were comfortable as all the time we were out exploring Singapore. Everything is in a short reach; the nightlife at Clarke Quay, Orchard Road or Chinatown.In fact we walked down to Marina bay on the new year's midnight to watch the fireworks. we were two couples and enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Defintely Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpkemble
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really phenomenal for the price of the room, but that was all I found phenomenal. Of course, I expected the great price (for Singapore) would come with trade-offs. The trade offs are lack of personality. The rooms are functional but not spacious. The bed could use some sort of bedspread. I felt like I was staying in a hospital. Actually, I was visiting a friend IN the hospital, and his room had more charm. The staff was friendly enough and breakfast, which is included, is adequate with both Western & Asian fare. The Internet was not great. If you're going to make someone pay for Internet, it should be fast and reliable. I regularly use Skype, but the connection was too intermittent and I was unable to have a conversation without the call dropping every few minutes. Overall, if you're on a budget and want a great location, this is definitely one to consider. If you want a memorable experience on your vacation, better spend a bit more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average quality”
Reviews.Author: Maxim77
Reviews.Content: Located on a small Robertson Quay - between Clarke Quay and Boat Quay. Before the Metro Clark Quay 15 minute walk. Location is good. I visited Singapore, I realized for myself that the best place where to stay here - Quay, Marina Bay is the ideal, but since everything is expensive - it makes sense to search surrounding areas. So the location is OK, except far to the subway. But the number of buses running. Rooms too small, but fine. There is a kettle, coffee and tea for two sachets, cream and sugar. King-size bed. But the prices are too high. I booked for 130 singdollars (higher than 100 usd) for 1 night, for booking two nights 260 sgd. The ratio of personnel is so-so. Wi-Fi in the lobby for a fee, can not remember exactly - daily fee, while need use in half an hour - hour a day. There is a computer - hourly fee. Breakfast is so-so. The next time I would not take.

Reviews.Title: “very old hotel in need of major renovations”
Reviews.Author: AnnTai
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night in Dec 2011 and man, was i disappointed. I had thought it would be a four-star hotel given its location and name, but it ended up giving me the impression that it was just a 2-and-a-half-star hotel. we stayed in the deluxe room (twin-sharing at room 703). Room was clean but it was very small. Had a great view of the pool but quickly realised that the pool actually belonged to the posh hotel next door. the bathroom had a standing-room only shower area, a toilet bowl and a sink that looked like mine back in the 1980s. the ceramic tiles of the bathroom area are exactly those you find in public toilets at coffeeshops in Singapore (those that are old, smelly and disgusting, cos i think some coffeeshops have better tiles now). i had some bruises on my knees after showering, cos i kept hitting the faucet when i had to soap my feet. super disappointed with robertson quay hotel's 'pool', it is actually a round circular pond which contained murky water. the common areas had carpets but these were old and mouldy. the 'continental breakfast' was a joke, cos they only served toast, baked beans, chicken frankfurts, juice, milk and cereals. there was no omelette or fried vermicelli, but i guess it was all snapped up by the time we went down at 10am. won't go back again. for the price i paid ($150 per night), i expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Johan A
Reviews.Content: I'm puzzled by the negative reviews here about this hotel since my stay was fantastic. The rooms are small but definitely not too small. We stayed in a double and it was fine for two persons with plenty of space for our clothes and stuff. The bathroom was great and everything seemed to be brand new, including the flat screen TV. Breakfast every morning, they keep putting out more until 10:00 and it was never crowded. The pool area on the third floor also very clean and nice place to relax with an outdoor gym as well. Staff was very helpful and service minded. The only bad thing is that they don't provide free internet service. Wifi costs $5,90 a day and is only available in the lobby. The best thing about the hotel is the location. You can easily get to the nightlife at Clarke Quay, shopping at Orchard Road or Chinatown and the fantastic views at Marina Bay. All within short reach. We walked to and from the hotel to all of these places without problem. All in all, it's a great hotel with good value for money. If they would set up a wifi-connection available in the whole hotel it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: wanjoboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a twin room. The guys the reception were very helpful and friendly. We came in around 11am and they politely informed us that check-in is strictly at 2pm, but they already checked us in right away, we just can't go up our room. So we decided to explore the area till the time we can go up. Left our luggage at the lobby, literally, they're just sitting there at the lobby entrance with the rest of the luggage from other guests, in plain sight, no locked chain or whatever. But hey, it's Singapore, one of the safest places on earth. The room was not that large, but the AC was good, the bed was comfy, we asked for two extra pillows and they gave us four. The view was nice. If you can, ask for a room with the view of the pool and the river. The thing I didn't like with the room is the bathroom. I think our two-door ref at home is bigger than the shower area. I'm 6'2 and I can hardly move when taking a shower, that's the only downside. Hot water is working perfectly. Yeah, bathroom is really really small. Breakfast is included and it's the same everyday...eggs, sausage, cereal, beans, bread, juice, coffee, milk...that's it. But the location of this hotel is fantastic! The hotel is surrounded by bars and restos, just a few strides from the hotel by the river. It's 10 minutes walk to Clark Quay, and it's really safe walking home at 2am. The bus stop is near the hotel, so that's a plus too. Orchard Road is only two or three stops away -- bus no. 64. And the area, Riverside Quay is mostly frequented by Caucasians, so is Clark Quay. We paid SGD20 or so for cab fare from the airport to the hotel. And it's about the same when we left.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Morten1475
Reviews.Content: We had a stopover in Singapore on our way to Malaysia. Our criteria was price and location, and for Singapore, this hotel fills both requirements. It is a good basic+ hotel with a nice pool. The best thing about this hotel is the location by the river and not very far to the city center (Orchard Road).

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel. You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: BogusVille
Reviews.Content: Toilet didn't flush, kettle stopped working, fridge didn't work, horrid smell from the entrance towards the rooms. Not very friendly staff. Buffet in the morning over crowded and badly managed. Food is so so. swimming pool is good enough to go in circles, size of room I stayed in is small but livable compared to others, out door gym is probably never been used but overlooks the Park Hotel Clarke Quay's swimming pool. =) but on the brighter side, this is ideal for you pub crawlers and backpackers who just want to stay at a more central location and soak up the life in Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Very Basic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lazza29
Reviews.Content: Mine was a short stay over in Singapore which suited my choice of this hotel fine. My criteria was price and location, and for Singapore, this hotel fills both requirements, especially the latter. So long as you know what you are expecting with this hotel, you shouldn't be disappointed. If your goal is to spend as little as possible on a hotel, but still have some place that is clean, while offering an excellent location, this is the place to stay. Amenities: The hotel provides VERY basic accommodation - a room and a bed. The room and bathroom were clean, but quite small and generally very tired looking. It was a twin bed room but the bed did fit my 6'2" frame. It had a small (23cm?) CRT style (i.e not flat screen) tv with cable channels, and a small fridge. The fridge does not come stocked - you may buy beer, soft drinks and some snacks in the downstairs lobby or, as I did, go to the 7-11 within a 60 sec walk. The staff were pleasant enough, however you do not book into this hotel expecting any extra service. The included breakfast buffet was again basic, but certainly edible and filling. The BEST thing about this hotel is that it has a FANTASTIC location, literally a 1min walk to the Singapore River and a large variety of eateries at Robertson Quay. Just a quick 5mins walk away is the very popular Clark Quay, and a further 5 min walk is Singapore's original food and night life street, Boat Quay. It is not more than a 5min taxi ride to Orchard Road, and perhaps 10mins at best to the Marina Bay Sands casino and integrated resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: CimThan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 days of my holiday. Excellent location that's close to the shopping malls and even closer to the nightspots of Clarke Quay. Friendly and helpful staff that even guided us to the best chili crab in Singapore! Big window view, excellent air-con BUT very small restroom and shower area... even by Asian standards! In short, stay here if you want to be where the action is and you're on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable rates for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Taipei921
Reviews.Content: Booking through its own website or a hotel booking website yields about the same rate, though the hotel website is cheaper by a dollar+. Room is clean, small, but come with large windows facing towards the Singapore River view and the pool below. Adequate amenities like soap dispenser, hair dryer, 21" LCD TV, electric kettle with tea and coffee sachets. Wired internet chargeable. Small bathroom stall, but hot water is working fine! AT SGD 130++, it comes with basic breakfast, good for stuffing yourself with buns, toast, coffee and some congee before hitting the road. Aircon in room is cold, no matter how you control the termostat, but solved the problem by switching it off! Good location, though not near to any train station, but walking distance to Clarke Quay oposite for pubs abd restaurant, plus shopping at Liang Court. Good for families, couples, or travellers on a budget. Not exactly very cheap for back packers, but it is clean, and staff are efficient. Free parking for those who drive, great feature as parking in the city is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ringdais
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 5.30am. Given a great welcome, stored luggage and set off for the day being told to come back to check in at 12.30. We were walking along the Singapore River when a huge downpour occurred. We stepped in to the BeerWorks Micro Brewery and met an Aus gent who was a pilot with Singapore Air. He recommended places to eat and in general was a great ambassador for Singapore

Reviews.Title: “good position but the room are orrible”
Reviews.Author: gioiaclaudio
Reviews.Content: room"s are really to small, the bath was so small that if you do the shower ,nobody can get s in

Reviews.Title: “for what we paid, okay...”
Reviews.Author: DoctorOctopus
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 3 nights en route to Sydney. It was a cheap hotel and usable. However, you don't pay for any perks. For what we needed, it sufficed. It was clean and tidy. One point to note: the hotel only has one disabled access room and the bathroom cubicle still has a small step in and out. If you are unsteady on your feet (like me!) BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Decent at the very least...”
Reviews.Author: wertyyy
Reviews.Content: Staying here with friends turned out to be an awesome idea despite te negative reviews i read here... True, the rooms may be slightly smaller than 4 or 5 star hotels but it is cosy and has all the necessary amenities provided. This is made even more acceptible by the price per night. I mean you have got to find this a bargain. The location is in the vicinity of the city with a vibrant night life which was a bonus i wasnt expecting. Office buildings and the business district is literally a stone's throw away so staying here on a business trip is definitely not a bad idea. Staff were cordial and extremely polite and helpful. I'd say this place is very reasonable indeed. Normally you get what you pay for, but in this case i definitely got much more. WIll seriously come again next year !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Hole in Singapore - No Go Zone”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible place. We only stayed there because due to the F1 Grand Prix there was a shortage of other accommodation. The rooms are the size of a stamp, the bathroom is literally smaller than a cubicle. You wouldn't even swing a cat in the whole room. There is no room for anything. The bed is hard, tiny. The whole set-up is below budget accommodation, hostels have better and cleaner facilities. Location is not bad, but that is the only thing going for this hole. Breakfast is a stodgy affair, unappealing in the extreme. My only advice is to avoid this place. A word to management: there is room for improvement in the quality of rooms and everything else. As the location is acceptable (not the best, but at least competitive), it is a mystery why you would continue offering this quality in a city of luxury at affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you book this...”
Reviews.Author: mcgurtiza
Reviews.Content: Location is far from the action, you have to walk 15 to 20 minutes to reach the MTR and the Clark Quay River. Breakfast in the hotel is very simple, the bathroom is horrible - strong cigarette smell (though it's a non smoking room) and very small shower area. Place is not recommended for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Small, compact rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: smattox114
Reviews.Content: Room is good for one person for a short stay. Room is very compact but good location and cheap for Singapore. You won't want to spend much time in your room. Bathroom is very small and shower is much like what you would find on a boat. The room was decently clean but remember, you get what you pay for and Singapore is not cheap. Would only recommend to someone if they were staying for a short period and single.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kaasmeisje
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located around the corner from Clarke Quay. The room was small (especially the shower) but nice. I did not fancy a swim while in this hotel, but also the pool was tiny. Breakfast was a let-down with very few options - just eggs, toast and beans. If I ever visit Singapore again, I will seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst we have EVER seen! Recommend AVOID.”
Reviews.Author: PerthNick
Reviews.Content: Disgustingly old, small with a terrible bathroom that we could not even close our eyes to use. We have used better public bathroom facilities than what is offered at this hotel. We checked out within an hour of checking in because it was that bad and we lost all money paid in cancellation fees, they were not even willing to meet us half way. Disgusting. Staff were inexperienced, unfriendly, unhelpful and in denial about the state of the hotel and everything costs extra in this hotel, such as Wi-Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Budget accommodation, good Clark Quay location , clean bedroom poorly designed bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: stinoo1
Reviews.Content: Budget hotel, good for a 1-2 night stay. Walking distance to bars and restaurants (good night life scene around Clarke Quay). Nice views from riverside rooms. Price was average by Singapore standards. Only downside was poorly designed bathroom that could not be cleaned well. Shower and everything gets wet. Stayed with my girlfriend who was not too concerned about cleanliness of bathroom. Staff were very helpful. I can recommend this hotel to singles and young couples on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “"Terrible, small and Misleading advertisement"”
Reviews.Author: ed T
Reviews.Content: My family, both parents, 2 small kids and us arrived at the hotel at noon. 2 weeks prior to our arrival, we booked the hotel thru the internet. Went to the hotel's website and looked at the pictures (inside/outside) and it looked great! When we all arrived at the hotel, we did not believe how misleading the hotel's advertisement. The hotel was SMALL (you can't even move in the room with 2 people let along with 2 kids). The bathroom was very small and dirty. the hotel basically looks like what we call here in the US "Hotel by the hour". We immediately went down to the front desk and told them that we want to cancel our stay there. I dont think it is appropriate for my 2kids to be staying there. Instead of understanding our concern, the front desk (manager) charged us for the night eventhough we did not even unpack inside the room. the front desk (manager) is un-proffesional similar to where you would fine at 1 star hotel which this hotel should be. I paid for 1 night and move my family to marina mandarin a better hotel, proffesional and great service.

Reviews.Title: “good situation in town, poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: silverring
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 4 days with our 2 kids, excellent to go downtown, correct breakfast, beds were o.k., poor bathroom. not recommend to stay for a whole vacation, pool is quite small and old, could be repainted, but still our kids played there to cool off after a busy day. Price Quality is fair

Reviews.Title: “Basic but excellent location and pool”
Reviews.Author: Henk001
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here; for the money, location and pool, it is ok, hotels in singapore are expensive. the hotel is due for a make-over. the breakfast is crammed, simple and nothing worthwhile to report on.

Reviews.Title: “More of a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: affairoftheart
Reviews.Content: The photos on the website are absolutely different from the actual old. The entire hotel feels kind of budget. From the reception area to the room; especially the bathroom. The bathroom is cramp and small. Staffs is kind of inexperience, slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: matulessy_alice
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through one of the online travel agents. I found the rate was quite high compare to the quality of the hotel. The hotel was really small. Room was quite old, but the room size was ok to accommodate 2 adults and 1 child 5 years old. Bathroom was really small, I hardly find space to put my bathroom amenities. Hot water was on and off. Sometimes it became too hot even though i have adjusted it. Room facilities were rather old, small out fashioned TV, no cable TV channels for children. Only 1 small restaurant available, open only for breakfast. Breakfast was also very standard with asian and american breakfast menu. During breakfast, i had to come as early as possible to make sure i got the table. The queue was quite annoying. I just couldn't enjoy my breakfast while people were standing waiting and looking at others who were sitting. Hotel location was just 10 minutes away to Universal Studio by taxi. At the opposite of the hotel is the walking site where you can find many kind of restaurants. This is what we enjoyed during our family holiday in Singapore. Overall about the hotel and the area was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Aging hotel but it was clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: BrentM85
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights in July 2011 and found the hotel was perfectly acceptable without being much more. Everything was clean and pleasant and the bed comfortable. The area is quite nice and is quiet and the room had a good view over the river and towards the city centre. We thoroughly enjoyed Singapore and would recommend this place if you can get it for a good rate. At its most expensive you could find something a fair bit better I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: SORF01
Reviews.Content: Hotels are expensive in Singapore and this one appears to be reasonable value which you assume is because it is not located at Clark Quay or any of the more fashionable areas. However, for what it is, it really is not good value - better to go to Little India or Chinatown. The interior is really quite grotty both in the common parts and the bedrooms. The shower rooms were particularly in need of renovation. We didn't try breakfast as we had to leave fairly early and they weren't able to let us have an early breakfast (though it is included in the room price). We were very glad we only had to spend one night here and we definitely won't be back. This was not what we were expecting from the descriptions we had read on their website.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lengkok
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cheaper hotels in Singapore, but the location is great, close to eateries, Theatre across road, taxis outside, walking distance to Clarke Quay, which is full of bars restaurants entertainment so vibrant, walking distance to MRT, with direct line to catch the monorail to Universal Studios. The staff are so helpful and friendly, nothing is a problem to them, yes, it is in need of a refurb, but how much time do you spend in hotel, breakfast was okay and no complaints from my children who are well travelled and used to higher star hotels. If you want better facilities then pay for it in a fancy hotel it you want value for money stay here, no it does not have bugs, we were surprised at how clean it was, agree bathrooms are very dated and small but after the initial shock we found it working well and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare come true”
Reviews.Author: Ster07
Reviews.Content: Okay i travel very often and stay in every hotel but this one was horrible! You could barley fit 3 people in the room the bathroom were just big enough to slaughter a pig and there were bugs even on the 6th floor. The pool was very very small and not well maintained. Now there were two very fond memories at this hotel. One was leaving and the second was knowing never to come back again. Look at the V hotel it charges less and is so much better! Their pool was worth millions each room had a king sized bed all granite and marble finishes! There was room for even 7 huge suitcases! So this is my warning to those who dare to look at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Great location, Best prices”
Reviews.Author: svi6622
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was awesome. When i first walked in, cordial staffs greeted me politely and i was quickly checked in to my room; which was great at such a cheap price. It was cosy and clean. Definitely much better than expected at such a price. The location of the hotel was also splendid. With many shopping centres and other places of interest in the vivinity. Also, Clarke Quay is brimming with a vibrant nightlife which greatly appealed to me and my friends staying there. Many offices and business buildings were also nearby so staying here on a business trip also wouldnt be a bad idea.. Overall the hotel is an excellent bargain for its price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good tourist-class hotel, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: OldSalopian
Reviews.Content: In Singapore on business and spent 13 nights at the Robertson Quay Hotel in June 2011. I am a frequent visitor to Asia and as Singapore is getting incredibly expensive, I opted for this hotel because of its reasonable price. I read the TripAdvisor reviews before booking but took the advice of one of my local business contacts who told me I couldn't do better in terms of price or location. She was right. I had some concerns having read some of the negative comments here but I was worried unnecessarily. I was in a room on the 6th floor overlooking the Singapore River, the river walk and the park. I opted to pay five dollars Singapore a night supplement for a room with a queen sized bed and it was worth every penny. The room wasn't huge but it wasn't poky either. It was refurbished, clean, comfortable and the aircon worked well (an absolute necessity in Singapore) without sounding like a Saturn V rocket blasting off for the moon. The bed was comfortable and the linen, which was spotless, was changed daily - as were the towels. The shower/bathroom is small but again perfectly clean and functional with none of the mould and smell described in other reviews. Most people stay at the Robertson Quay for only a couple of days before moving on. Singapore as a tourist destination is of limited appeal (unless you are obsessed with buying overpriced luxury fashion in yet another OTT shopping mall) and all the sights and sites can be done in two or three days. As I was on a two week work assignment I got to know the hotel and its staff far better than others would and I found them to be helpful, friendly and polite if slightly reserved at first - but that's an ethnic Chinese thing, not rudeness. Sure the breakfasts get monotonous but that would be the case anywhere after a fortnight but they are substantial, filling and good. Usually a rice dish, eggs in various formats (omelette, fried, scrambled, boiled etc) baked beans, sausages (or rather frankfurters), white and brown bread/toast. butter, jam. orange juice, fruit, (fresh and preserved), yoghourt, tea, coffee. Plus the daily papers in English, Chinese and Malay. The dining room, which is up a few steps from the small reception area, is a bit dark and noisy because it is predominantly cool tiles over stressed concrete but it is perfectly functional. The hotel gets a lot of backpackers and families with children but the corridors were quiet at night and there were no disturbances. During the day mountains of luggage are housed temporarily on staging opposite reception, but these heaps dwindle during the day as groups head-off to the airport. The hotel's location is perfect. The walk along the river to Clarke Quay (left and then left again out of the hotel) takes about three minutes to where there is a huge choice of bars and restaurants. It's tourist trap and therefore pricey but it buzzes at night. To the right along the river is Robertson Quay, which is posher, quieter and attracts fewer tourists. Again there is a great selection of bars and restaurants that tend to be patronised by local residents (ex-pat and indigenous). Of course, all locations are perfectly safe. Criminals in Singapore get harsh prison sentences with "special" hard labour regimes for violent offenders while floggings, canings and hangings are commonplace. Offences against the person of visitors, tourists and foreign workers are very rare indeed and the police are tough and efficient. You get what you pay for in Singapore and you can pay a lot - apart from taxis which are ubiquitous and cheap as is the excellent subway system. I have stayed in hotels there that have been hugely expensive but by no means any better than the Robertson Quay. It's a rare bargain in a city state that is now becoming one of the most expensive destinations on the planet. I'll certainly be staying at the Robertson Quay Hotel again later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing going for this hotel is "Location"”
Reviews.Author: chey88
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here! If you think your getting a bargain (like I thought with breakfast inclusive) you will be sadly mistaken. The pictures are very misleading and nothing looks anything like it does on the website. The entrance is fill of luggage which makes it difficult to get to reception. I was there a total of 8 days and every day the front entrance was crowded. They charged extra to clean the rooms and replenish the towels, but honestly I thought that would be standard practise! I asked for extra pillows which were brought up for one day and taken back the next. We spent lots of time in the pool as it is very hot [day and night] and so we asked for additional towels which were also taken back everyday until I told front reception to leave extra towels and pillows in the rooms until we left. The pool is nothing like it looks in the pictures, very small and a maximum height of 1.2mtrs. The wall paper and ceilings are ripped, chipped and very mouldy smelling. The toilet/shower/bathroom is the size of a tiny linen cupboard, actually a linen cupboard is probebly bigger. Lets just say when your in the shower you can touch the sink and the flush the toilet at the same time....NOT GOOD. The whole place is very grotty, dusty and out dated. I cant speak harshly enough about the breakfast. The lady cooking the food looks like she isnt happy to be there and makes gestures when you go to get food. The menu was pathetic: rubbery, tasteless scrambled eggs that resembled chewing on an old tyre, canned baked beans, over cooked steamed sausages and bread with nothing more than butter and some sort of fruit spread. Every day the same thing. The people come and clean your table before you've finished eating and take your utensils and if your not there by 10 am on the dot you miss out. Any left over food/drink is removed. Overall this is a really shabby hotel and put a bit of a downer on my holiday. Fortunately Singapore has lots to keep you entertained and out of the hotel but please, please dont stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: onthemove062
Reviews.Content: Its a standard budget hotel, the staff are helpful, the rooms are clean, if some what small, the property is starting to show its age. The location is good and central to most things, China town is only a short walk, and the river is right next door. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So retro its almost cool - but not quite”
Reviews.Author: stressbunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. The interior is so 1970s it is almost hip again - but sadly not. Think floral headboard, orange and white bathroom, original wood fittings, old TV screen. It is hard to believe such a dated hotel exists in Singapore and harder to believe the bathroom/water closet is legal, given its tiny size and propensity to overflow onto the carpet outside. A large person would not be able to shower in here. The included breakfast is extremely basic ($8 value). This hotel should be marketed at backpackers, not mainstream tourists and as such was not good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dsl520t
Reviews.Content: The room is very small. Bathroom is very very small. The pool also very small. My Room has a pool view, the pool looked nice but it is Park Hotel's pool. Bed had stain on it. Staff is OK. Serve the same breakfast for the whole week. Location is near Clarke Quay, but far from MRT. Price is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient with very good service”
Reviews.Author: howard5200
Reviews.Content: The room was small but serviceable. There was a mix-up with the airport taxi that the front desk made good on - they paid the fair from the hotel to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “the location is great, the staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: christopherdb
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel since our flight didn't arrive until 130am and we knew we would not be there very long. This is a 3 star hotel. The location is great being located near the Singapore river. the rooms are very small, as are the pillows. The breakfast buffet was below average. There was no hot water kettle or coffee in the room. The staff almost make up for the negatives by being very helpful. There is a pool upstairs with a dry water slide but equipped with a nice little waterfall. If you just need a place to sleep, it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving, its a dump”
Reviews.Author: Tic50
Reviews.Content: We booked months in advance, our room was so cramped there was no room for our luggage and the bed was like sleeping on a concrete slab. The staff are not friendly and the place is dirty. The photos on the internet are not a true reflection, do not stay here its a dump.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: sanforge
Reviews.Content: great place to stay, night life, closer to the night clubs, mrt, restaurants, and river side view makes it great loaction and value for money but bathroom is really small and not suitable to even stand and have shower.

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location”
Reviews.Author: wittsNz
Reviews.Content: Firstly this is a BUDGET hotel . No frills . You get what you pay for. If you want fancy you have to pay for it. We enjoyed our stay here .Sure the bedroom is small and the bathroom .But guess what were far too busy and used our room precisely for what it is designed for and that was to sleep ,shower and have breakfast. The shower is awesome , great water pressure . We always slept well .Breakfast is adequate ..scrambled, omellete , Baked beans , Sausage , fried rice and fruit , toast .Juice , tea , coffee. Staff are friendly and helpful, the breakfast lady does an awesome job . The location is perfect ..loved the Turkish restaurant with happy hour across the road. The 7/11 shop where you can buy cheap beer etc also in that direction . Awesome view from the window . Nothing to complain about really . Showers have a mould problem and thats about it

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hotel rude staff small small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: egg6
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here very small rooms very dirty bathrooms very rude staff not what the pictures looks like it lies,mould that maid us sick all thought the bathrooms,Sat in water to go to the toilet, Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Andrew260271
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small the bath room is covered in mould. I have never stayed in a hotel that is so dirty. Had my sheets change because they were dirty only to be replaced with dirty ones. If I had not prepaid I would not have stayed the two nights outbid the four nights I had paid for. Had to find a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: wheather
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, earlier this month and found it to be quite adequate for the price we paid. We were out all day sightseeing, and found the location of this hotel to be very good - walking distance to Clarke Quay MRT, Boat Quay and Chinatown. The pool although small also, was wonderful to dip into at the end of the day. The rooms are very small ( and apparently all the same size). We had requested an upper floor for the view over the river, but had been allocated a room on the 2nd floor because that floor had been renovated, and I must say we were grateful to be there. It was a huge improvement on what I have seen of the other rooms. The bathroom was tiny, but nicely tiled, toilet very close to the wall and sliding door, so a bit difficult actually to place yourself on it!!!! I think a very large person would have a bit of trouble. Towels were indeed old, small and thin. Sheets clean and crisp. New Samsung television on the bench in the room. Breakfast was adequate, same each day, juice, choice of eggs, cereal, toast, sausage and baked beans and fried rice. Staff at reception were efficient and helpful. One thing to point out is that there is an Italian Restaurant below the hotel, which got quite busy at night, and we did hear the noise from there, although it didn't go late.We also had quite a nice view over the river from the room, even though only on the 2nd floor. All up I would probably stay there again, for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: honeybeaver
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel is close to Clarke Quay. Accommodation was clean and well priced - included good breakfast, staff extremely helpful. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulAnita
Reviews.Content: When we go to Singapore we want a clean room, hot water, a decent bed and breakfast, be it Western or Asian. We've been privileged to try various hotels in Singapore as our trips are always leisure and business combined. We've experienced excellent and disastrous 5* hotels and various budget hotels too. The Robertsons Quay tops some of the 4* and 5* hotels. The abovementioned date was our 9th stay at the Robertsons Quay. We like the fact that it's at the end of a Cul-de-Sac and the river view. It's quiet. The lobby and dinning room areas are small and so are the rooms and the shower, but it outshines all other budget hotels. The beds are good, breakfast is more than enough and the hotel is clean. The swimming pool area is beautiful. The staff are not over friendly, but that you see throughout Singapore. They are very helpful. For a budget stay, the Robertsons Quay is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service during breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MyChanel
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick. Request for late C/O till 2pm was unapproved. Unless $75 was charged. 1st room was accorded. Room was small and cramp. Bed sheet was stained. Very dusty. Toilet light was not working. 2nd room accorded, air-con was not working at all. 3rd room accorded and it was okay. Breakfast was a bad experience. Old chinese lady at the counter was very very rude and persisted on not serving ice water at all even if we mentioned that it was okay to charge. Insisted that bfast was over and will never serve anything to us. No service recovery was done and no apologies extended. We had a good stay despite the hotel's poor standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD080557
Reviews.Content: We had pre-booked and paid for three nights, arrived quite late and very tired only to find that the bedding was very stained. We had to get the bed changed before we would even contemplate sleeping in it. The towels were threadbare and useless. The shower room had so much mould on it, it was quite disgusting. There were notes posted in the lifts apologising for refurbishment. We did not see any sign of refurbishment. A stick of dynamite might help, then they could start. If we had not pre-paid we would have looked elsewhere. The only plus point is that it is in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but ripped off”
Reviews.Author: manonspot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights post cruise but got off to a bad start as during our 3 week cruise the credit card I had used to book this hotel through asia rooms had been cancelled due to suspicious activity without my knowledge.When we arrived we were told our booking had been cancelled and had to rebook through hotel itself at an extra £60 each.We had 4 cases with us and had no option but to pay up but it left a sour taste.Was even worse when we got in room to find peeling wallpaper and small shower.Asit was only 2 nights we made the best of it but have to say the view was lovely and hotel had nice swimming pool.Clarkes quay is 2 minutes walk and is very nice with lots of nice restraunts.you can get bus tour and river tour here and chinatown is about another 15 to 20 minute walk.the bars at Clarkes Quay are quite expensive but offer happy hours and 2 for 1 but chinatown is much cheaper and great if your into shopping.Signapore is absolutely beautiful and when we go back it will probably be at the same location but definately not at the robertson quay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Compact Hotel beside the Singapore River”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonGeorge
Reviews.Content: Very Close to the most happening place at Singapore, especially the Singapore River and Clarke Quay Only regular American Breakfast is provided. No provision for other meals/snacks Compact Rooms. but clean

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: BadSanta88
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located conveniently to Clark Quay and nightlife. Robertson Quay has plently of restaurants nearby as well as a 7 Eleven and a supermarket. Rooms are average size although showers are small by western standards. Air cons tend to run very cold and room has fridge. Staff are welcoming and friendly and requests are met with a prompt response. internet requires payment of $5.00 SGD per day. As we spent most of the day and night out and about, the room satisfied our needs at a reasonable price. Would stay there again if returning to Singapore. Taxi fares are cheap to get anywhere that you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Well located flea pit”
Reviews.Author: thePaulhongkong
Reviews.Content: Having previously stayed at a hotel nearby which was excellent but full (Studio M) and being familiar with the convenient location, I found this hotel on booking.com which looked fine online. However, the description and pictures were totally misleading. The room was tiny and dirty (sheets stained etc) and the shower looked like something from a hostel. Although the hotel boasted a pool and a gym, the pool was filthy and the slide into the pool would do serious damage if used and the gym was outside with faulty filthy equipment. To add to this, the hotel was not cheap (similar to the price of Studio M). My room was noisy (at the side of a noisy bar and the entrance open to the breakfast area, the noise and smell of eggs started early)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible is a small word to describe this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ranjana30
Reviews.Content: Staff is rude & irresponsible. No Bellboy. Only 6 staff members in hotel. Breakfast is very monotonous of scramble and hard boiled eggs, boiled sausages, fruit juice and bananas. Only one cook (one old lady) to make breakfast for 400 guests. Room is too small and furnishing is terrible. But all & all Hotel has an excellent location if you are a night person just a walking distance from Clark Quay.Getting around is quite accessible with the Clark Quay MRT Station just across the river. In my 20 days visit of Thailand, Malaysia & Singapore only this hotel is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for a Singapore stopover”
Reviews.Author: EsJayUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights en route to Australia. The room was big enough for two people although the bathroom was tiny & the shower drenched the whole bathroom! It felt clean although some of the linen was stained. The breakfast was sufficient. For the price in Singapore, its a good hotel. The location was very good and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value”
Reviews.Author: norge2011
Reviews.Content: We chose Robertson Quay Hotel because we are travelling with kids and wanted a swimming pool, a central location and not too pricy a place. We got all three. Stayed in connecting rooms, perfect for us. The pool is small, but very nice. Our room had views to the river, others had fantastic views over the city. The lobby is a bit dark, and if you take the stairs you can see the hotel could use some mainatance, but rooms are clean and serve their purpose. We spent evenings on the pool terrace overlooking the city life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: stefanplaza
Reviews.Content: Great location if you you want to have fun on the Quay River. I got back before i threw up after to much to drink. A 15 minutes walking distance to MRT. I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymakers48
Reviews.Content: Photos on hotel's website are deceiving. The rooms are really small, you can just walk around the bed. The toilet and shower combined is tiny. No shower barrier or curtains, so when you shower, everything gets wet! No furniture apart from the bed as there's no room. The air conditioning temperature was set really high. It only allows you to set it at low, medium or high. I found the low setting, too cold and had to ask for a couple of extra blankets at night. We stayed for 8 nights over Xmas as it was reasonably priced and central. Every other hotel near by were more expensive, so we stuck to where we were. Breakfast is EXACTLY the same every morning. Really boring . When it gets really really busy, they can't cope. They run out of plates, cups, cutlery, food... they hand wash everything, so hence the wait. They also run out of tables and chairs at peak time. Breakfast area very dark. The only good thing is they provide a couple of newspapers very morning. The swimming pool is small. The fitness centre is outdoors but covered, so you could get really hot when doing your workout. The only good thing is that its so central to the city. Access to MRT is approx 10 minutes walk. It's also close to Clarke Quay. Staff are OK, but you need to ask for everything. They need to learn to smile and be more hospitable. The hotel itself is run down and in need of a good uplift.

Reviews.Title: “i would never recommend this to anyone”
Reviews.Author: tinkilily
Reviews.Content: well, i booked a hotel room thinking that since it was at boat quay (a rather happening and upmarket area in Singapore), i couldnt go wrong. i had intended to spring a surprise birthday and hen's night party for a very good friend. boy, was i utterly embarrassed at the state of the hotel. it was absolutely quiet even at 9ish. making it seemed like a haunted hotel. and the interior was really in need of refurbishing. the moment i stepped in, the hotel gave me a dodgy and creepy feeling. after all the hyped and excitement preparing for the party for weeks, the hotel really brought the entire anticipation down two thousand notches. i just hope my friend didnt think she had cheapskate friends. the toilet was another sorry sight. my home's toilet is in a better condition and it's not even 3 star to begin with. i gotta thank my mom for her hardwork keeping the home spick and spack. there was no curtain. and it was VERY tiny. i think even toilets in work dormitories are in better conditions. and mind you, i paid S$150+ after taxes for this mess. the money could have been better spent. oh one last thing, breakfast was just baked beans, boiled sausages, porridge, cereal and some other forgettable spread. really, please book this hotel only if you have no other option.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! I wouldn't advise anyone to go there because you can do better.”
Reviews.Author: michaelpohlin
Reviews.Content: Double room is just too small and furnishing is terrible and the whole hotel in need of repair or upgrade. A shower curtain is deemed a luxury and you have to plead for it. The pictures of the hotel and the rooms in the internet are very deceiving. Dining area for breakfast is dark and gloomy. And breakfast is very monotonous of scramble and hard boiled eggs, boiled sausages, fried rice, fruit juice and bananas. The only positive aspects are great location and great views of river. For the same price you can get always get something better.

Reviews.Title: “rooms much to small”
Reviews.Author: buzzzz190762
Reviews.Content: the rooms were much to small also the windows were locked shut and the music from the bistro was to loud and went on far to long

Reviews.Title: “Your budget hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gibe_kkk
Reviews.Content: Robertson Quay Hotel has an excellent location if your a night owl just a stone throws away from Clark Quay.....Getting around is quite accessible with the Clark Quay MRT Station just across the river....Has a good Jog path....However rooms are too small it's a actually a compact size hotel room, with all the ammenities......If you spend most of your time outside.... then this hotel is recommended, It's basically a budget hotel,....with Complimentary breakfast for online bookings the only drag is that they serve the same breakfast buffet day in day out...well as far as i have stayed there......Hope they can improve the room size...Staff service is just on the average......

Reviews.Title: “small but great”
Reviews.Author: SophieJo77
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close enough to Clarke Quay but without the noise. I was bunking with my mum but instead of giving us 2 single beds they gave us a double. Not so bad but the room itself was a weird shape and very small compared to what I was used to. Price wise wasn't worth the size of the room but because of its location it made the price a bit fairer. Room was old but once again we were there to see sites and weren't spenidng much time in the room so we could get over the fact that it was small and old. Had wireless internet which was a HUGE bonus for me. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Garbage! Worst hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Bizler2009
Reviews.Content: It's easy to go over the top with a review like this when you're dissapointed, but seriously - I can objectively say that this is the worst hotel I've ever stopped in. Ever. Tatty, miserable, tiny, dirty room, with threadbare towels and consistenly dirty threadbare bed linen. Rubbish breakfast offering, the highlight of which must be watching the 'chef' open a tin of baked beans and pouring them straight in to a serving tray. I understand there are different eating/serving customs around the world (and as I travel a lot - I've seen many), but I've never known anyone serve cold baked beans at breakfast before!!! Internet (WiFi or wired @ 5SGD/24 hours) has a pittyful speed (approx 0.04Mb/s) - so next to useless. Location is good at the Robertson Quay, but that's the hotels' only saving grace. Seriously, go somwhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “great location near the riverside...but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gumshuda
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location and price...but the rooms are very very small...the bathroom is a pigeon hole....good food...but no restaurant...near to clark quay area...good for backpackers and couples......

Reviews.Title: “Crap, total crap, changed after one night”
Reviews.Author: mankur
Reviews.Content: What a crappy hotel! Cant say good or bad service, because I didnt get any!! For a 3/4 star hotel, the room does not have room service. Im a vegetarian, and nothing was there in the buffet. When I asked if they could serve anything, the girl replies no, and walks off!! I am not that big, and if I could not fit in the bathroom, I really doubt anyone can. We had no space to keep our luggage, so it was all on the floor, in this super super tiny, half a room. The paid wi fi kept loosing signal. Old hotel which definitely needs a renovation. I wish I had taken some photos so everyone could see what I mean. Check out time was 12 PM, and I got 4 calls between 11:45 and 12:15, so finally frustated we just changed the hotel in one night, ruined otherwise a perfect trip for us!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, good quality”
Reviews.Author: phayisin
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I really enjoyed our stay at the Robertson Quay Hotel. Located by the Singapore River, the hotel is very near a wide range of restaurants and shops. It is also within easy commuting distance of the City Centre and Orchard districts. Our room was quite a good size, well big enough for the 2 of us anyway, it was clean and well maintained, with a daily maid service. Our only disappointment was the bathroom which was a little on the small side, although having said that, the shower itself was easily big enough for us. Overall we enjoyed our stay, and would recommed this as a good quality mid-range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star location, 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lookalikea
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again but you need to know its like a tiny dorm room but with a very comfortable queen size bed and a fabulous view ! The bath is well under par as are the towels but the bed, bed linens and one pillow each are highest quality - so they have it right where it really counts. We prefer two pillows each but did not ask. Bring you own toiletries and buy some flowers to jazz it up. Then get out quayside to really enjoy Singapore - there's way too much to do to stay couped up in even a large room. It is right on Robertson Quay with Riverpoint across the quay and Central MRT and Chinatown a little further along. It is just steps to fabulous Clarke Quay, a few more steps to Boat Quay, and Canning Park is close by if you must leave the quayside. We stayed in a large upgraded deluxe room at the Singapore Fairmont earlier on same trip and its decor was dull also and not near as happening a location at this time, it was around 400 a night and that's without breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, easily accessible to Clarke Quay MRT Station”
Reviews.Author: chrisngSabah
Reviews.Content: I was there for 4 nights, surprisingly 1 night when I was taking a taxi from Orchard Road back to hotel, the taxi driver couldn't find the hotel, even with the so called "Advance GPSR". At last, I was the nevigator for him, pity more that I have to fort out the "Extra" journey he brought me around ~ Just a word from him "Sorry ah! bring you around". The staff were very helpful and keep it up. The hotel should provide bell service or at least make a way for guest to pull the luggages instead of carrying it up the staircase towards the lift area. Daily breakfast was provided but not excited at all, everyday almost the same food served.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRALLY LOCATED WITH SMALL BUT COMFORTABLE ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: neenaChandigarh
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay in heart of city with walkable distance to eating places,shopping,night life and beautiful riverside view.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable room and service”
Reviews.Author: chloepau
Reviews.Content: the room and toilet is so small but very acceptable considering singapore is known for small hotel rooms. there is hot and cold water, tv,ref,phone and above all hair dryer :). the staff are not that friendly in a sense that they are "all smiles" but would give in to your requests. i did not consume the complimentary breakfast since its the same thing everyday, but all in all i had good night sleeps there...and the hotel location is within the good night spots

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel, noisy and small rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: pemburu47
Reviews.Content: The room was very small. The aircon or some equipment on the roof top made a terrible noise preventing from sleep. The hotel needs badly a remake. Many new hotels coming up in close vicinity with much better service and cleanliness. Not really value for money.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: gembob82
Reviews.Content: stayed here as part of a stop over on the way to australia and needed somewhere cheap & cheerful to stay for 3 nights. Arrived at hotel at 8.30 am and were told we couldnt check in till afternoon. we'd just come off a 13hr flight so we just collapsed on a sofa in reception and after a while the staff took pity on us and let us check in. The rooms are v small, in particular the bathrooms but we didnt really spend much time in them. Didnt use the pool as weather wasnt really the best. The hotel is located right in the heart of the entertainment district and there are lots of shops and bars, including hooters!, within a 5 minute walk, also close to train links. Good base for a few days stay although there was a distinct lack of english people in the hotel and area in general. Breakfast was basic but edible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable & clean hotel, with GREAT views”
Reviews.Author: kat_ryb
Reviews.Content: March 2010 Reception staff v friendly and check in was hassle free. Our flight arrived very early so we got to the hotel about 11.00 but couldn’t check in early unless we paid a fee (that seemed quite a lot) but we were able to leave our bags there no problem and go off sightseeing and check in later. We had a room on the top floor, overlooking the river & city and though this was ace for the price. The room was VERY small, but knew this before we went from other reviews, and it was fine as there is a massive window ledge you can put your suitcases on. Our twin room had 2 small single beds, but they had a reasonable gap between them so you don’t feel too intimate with your friend. Bathroom is a wet room style, never had any hot water through and the shower and the bathroom was a bit tired (cracked tiles etc). However, it was all v clean, both bathroom and shower. Room has aircon, safe, TV & hairdryer. Location is great is you don’t mind a bit of walking – you can pretty much get everywhere or at least walk to an MRT station to travel further afield. Breakfast was ok, bread/toast, rice, egg, sausage, coffee and orange ‘juice’ (more like squash). Breakfast got quite busy between 9 and 10 though, with long queues for food and waits for a table. The pool is several storeys high, and has superb views. I think its unheated as the water was quite cold despite it being very warm weather.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view and on a budget”
Reviews.Author: ekrobertson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel in early January for the last 3 years and have always had a pleasant stay. The rooms are not large and the bathrooms are small but everything is always spotlessly clean. Staff are friendly and always extremely helpful. The location on the banks of the Singapore River near Clarke Quay is simply the best (and I have stayed in several hotels in Singapore); there is a great outdoors restaurant where you can sit and watch the passing parade in the evening. Walking distance to the sights and sounds of Chinatown; near the Clarke Quay MRT giving you access to the whole of SIngapore and of course you can walk to Clarke Quay with its abundant restaurants and Boat Quay a short walk from there. The Hotel also has a pool where you can sit and enjoy the sun and fresh air. A bargain in bustling Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A not really good experience”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0510Sing
Reviews.Content: Mold and dirt in the bathroom/shower. Yes the shower is the toilet. Everything getting wet during taking a shower. A/c much to cold. Don't believe the lies written at their internet side.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: filthyrichfil
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on 2 occasions 11/1/10 and 14/5/10. On both occasions we have found staff to be friendly, rooms and particularly bathrooms very small. However adequate for our needs of a 2day stopover to other destinations. If reservations booked on line, free buffet breakfast usually bacon, eggs, tomatoes, fried rice, sausages, juice, toast and fruit. Very good value. Convenient location near Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel for a common man”
Reviews.Author: navinbhas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was actually booked by my company since it was a business trip.. I have stayed at many hotels, since I'm a frequent traveller because I have got a service job. This one Robertson Quay, I could rate it as an average hotel. I really liked the place where the hotel is located, on the banks of Singapore river... The location was beautiful. Regarding the service, I dont know actually how is it at Singapore, because you wouldn't get any help regarding room services. There wouldn't be any1 to carry your luggages so try to find out something else for your heavy luggages. The hotel provides complimentary breakfasts but since I was there for a period of 2 weeks I got a bit bored with the same menu. The room is less spacious, and even if u wanna watch TV then you need to know chinese, because most of the channels are chinese. So couldn't spend time watching tv. Its got a swimming pool, better to say a small kids pool. Well overall the stay was pleasant, the budget is a little high regarding the room expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel walking distance to most things”
Reviews.Author: woodsda
Reviews.Content: A small hotel in good location. Rooms were certainly small, but comfortable, even when travelling with 3 year old child. Due to lack of floor space she actually slept on window sill but worked out fine. Nice breakfast and helpful staff. As per previous reviews, make sure you request a room on higher level facing river, they were very accomodating of our request.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, great location, but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: derby2
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, and bathroom was tiny (so small they have to put the bathmat outside the bathroom door). Could do with painting and general overhaul. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. Can't fault location, staff were helpful, and the continental breakfast (also included cooked items) wasn't bad. Swimming pool was OK if you don't mind swimming in circles. For a small room it did have kettle, TV, fridge and broadband / wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, decent service but the bathroom end abruptly”
Reviews.Author: sidney_jec
Reviews.Content: had a nice stay, pleasant hotel.. the bathrooms were however were VERY small.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cheap rates but tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: shanemat84
Reviews.Content: While we had low expectations, it is after all a budget hotel, we did think that the whole place could do with a lick of paper and a good cleaning. Having arrived in from a long haul flight we were eager to shower before seeing the city but found a complete shortage of towels and a tiny bathroom to be somewhat off putting. Did however limit our time in the hotel to the bare minimum as we had an early flight the next morning. Proximity to Clark Quay with its extensive nightlife is a big plus. Wouldnt be my first choice on a return visit and think people can do better for a few bucks more.

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice but you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Tinishasha
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located near Clarke Quay which is quite nice. Rooms are very small and bathroom even smaller but for Singapore the price is decent so as my title says, you get what you paid for. Would probably stay there again if no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are travelling on your own, have no bags, and dont expect service.”
Reviews.Author: XR8Chic
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location - I will give it that! However, when we first arrived, the staff were not very helpful at all. My cousin had an injured foot, and had to hop up the stairs from the reception to the lift. This left me to carry the 6 bags. The 2 men at reception just sat there and stared at us. Didn't offer to help me even move the bag to the lifts. The rooms are very tiny. We were in a room with 2 single beds - they were actually too long for the area they were in, and intruded into the passage way in the room. The bed linen smelled, had several stains, holes, and cigarette burns. There was no place to put your bags (except between the beds). Which made it impossible to move about the room. The safe did not work (probably because the whole front panel had been ripped off it), the TV did not work. There was no shower curtain which led to everything in the tiny bathroom getting wet (towels, toilet paper etc etc) I paid for the wireless internet in the room, only to discover it would not actually pick up a signal in the room. I could only get a signal when I was in the hallway. Breakfast was OK. Not very much variety though. I used my credit card to pay for this hotel, it was the only time on this trip that I used my credit card. After my return to Australia, I was very shocked to find out that my credit card had been skimmed, and used to purchase multiple airlines tickets with airasia, and numerous other internet purchases. As I currently am unable to prove without a doubt that this was done by Robertson Quay Hotel staff, as the fraud is still under investigation by the authorities, I would highly recommend paying with cash if you do choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Put off by rude staff - bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: CGGY
Reviews.Content: I checked in RQ hotel recently and had one of the worst experience staying in Singapore. Everything was ok (nothing spectacular) during check in. While the room was small, I thought that it was still value for the rate. HOWEVER, the whole experience changed during breakfast the next day. Firstly, there were not enough tables and chairs for the guests of the hotel - so we were requested to sit outside which is fine if not for the fact that the chairs and tables outside are all tied up, making it dificult for us to sit there. As the outside area was quite far away from the buffet breakfast area, we requested for a tray so that it's easier for us to carry our food; which was met with a look of disgust particularly by the lady who was manning the food counter. She very rudely asked us for our room number loudly and told us to bring the tray back (again in a loud and impatient manner). We could still tolerate the rough treatment at that point but the pinnacle of it was when I was taking 2 cups of coffee on my tray and at the same time decided to pour some soy sauce into a bowl for hardboiled eggs. To manage the situation, I put the tray momentarily on the banquet table just next to me and proceeded to pour the soy sauce very quickly - upon which i heard a loud, rude and commanding voice saying "MADAM, PLEASE GET THE TRAY OF THE TABLE AND CARRY IT TO YOUR OWN TABLE". Now, she could see I was pouring the soy sauce which will take only less than 1 min, plus my table is outside of the area which is a bit far - why could she not have asked in a more polite and appropriate manner if really it is against the hotel policy to put the tray there. But the point is it was not obstructing anyone or causing any inconvenience plus it will only take a moment to do what I am supposed to do before i go off to my table. It was not exactly a pleasant experience to be shouted to in front of all the guests. I could only say that my friend and I have been to other hotels, both budget and non-budget. While I do not have high expectations for RQ as it is cheaper, I also do not expect to be treated rudely! Unfortunately, this experience has really told me not to go back to RQ nor to recommend this to anyone for their visit to Singapore. It sucks!

Reviews.Title: “What a hole!”
Reviews.Author: caitaintdead
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I immediately knew something was just not right with this 'hotel'. The staff on front desk were unhelpful and unfriendly. There are 5 or 6 stairs to get to the lift and of course - no help with your luggage so I DEFINITELY wouldn't recommend this place for anyone eldery or with prams. The worst thing about this hotel - the bathrooms. The smallest bathrooms I've ever seen (and I've stayed in tiny-hoteled-London!). I didn't wash my hair for the week I stayed there because there was simply not enough room! The worst part though was that they were disgusting - moldy, mildewed and water damaged. The sheets on the bed had stains and was in general just a stuffy, uncomfortable room. The location is fine - but I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. I've stayed in backpackers that have been 10 times better then this horrible place - it should be shut down. One more thing - I had been looking forward to a week of great breakfasts... And just let me say, MacDonalds breakfasts ended up being a tasty treat after the revolting, shoddy breakfast offered. A giant serve of baked beans with toast and horrible coffee is not a breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel by far, that we have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: RenataAustralia
Reviews.Content: The smell of old cooking oil at reception was an instant let down. The Hotel is very old and can do with a complete make-over. Accessibility to the lifts was in adequate because of a staircase. When we got to our rooms it was even a bigger shock. The room was not up to standard because of mould on the ceiling an inadequate bathroom facilities. (could hardly shower, way too small) Due to the oil and stale smell we didn’t even attempt to have breakfast there once. We just couldn’t see ourselves staying there for the whole duration and decided to check out and booked into a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: larryvan
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for 5 days for a conference and would never come back. We had a tiny dingy little room that reeked like cigarettes. The shower was tiny and dark. The pool was small but had a great view. I actually laughed out lound when I went into the "gym." It was a closet with two old tred mills. The "jacuzzi" was a dirty tub of water in the locker room. I wouldn't put my tow in it. We had to pay $5 a day for the internet, but it never worked. You couldn't just sign up for the week either... we each had to come down every day and sign papers for the internet. Crazy. The thing is, if we were saving money, I would understand, but we paid $90 a night and that was a cheap conference rate! After the conference, I moved into the Scarlett Hotel and paid the same amount, but it was SUCH a difference. I highly reccomend the Scarlett. It was so cozy, clean, and great atmosphere. I honestly didn't even like Singapore until I moved into the Scarlett.

Reviews.Title: “attitude resolved”
Reviews.Author: grooving
Reviews.Content: The hotel did done a fair judgement to the client and the reception...After awhile the manager did reply my email and apologize regards the attitude that his staff has given so I think overall the hotel did do their part for taking care of the traveler be it stay or enquiry...so, I guess u all can give a try to stay at this hotel...Hope useful to u all

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: Wieda
Reviews.Content: small place but clean and appropriate .. but if u stay wit fams better consider another place.

Reviews.Title: “Good view, and good food around the hotel”
Reviews.Author: myfun29
Reviews.Content: just want to say very happy with the Roberston hotel service. i check in hotel in 27Dec and check out 28Dec. well the room is v clean and the breakfast are good. Onli the bathroom they dunno have bathtub. We check out on the next day and my partner had left something in the hotel..... But the hotel staff was very good to call me for the lost item. That is not a v valuable item but they are very gain the customer trust. I m very happen with they service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: AA_Gull
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel offering value for money in a city that can charge like a wounded bull. Not the most central location but a pleasant walk along the river to the MRT. Nice rooms, good pool and certainly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: MrsHereford
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in South-East Asia. The staff were very welcoming and helpful with computer use in the loby. Room was small but contained everything we needed. Very comfortable bed. Lovely bed linen, changd each day. Large window seat most useful.
