Small circular swimming pool with waterfall feature giving good views towards Clarke Quay which was a convenient ten minutes walk away, with superb choice of restaurants and MRT station. Breakfast fairly basic, but comfortable sofas nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calies99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the RQH for 5 nights in early October at the suggestion of our travel agent. On arrival at 8 pm we were met with a smile and were quickly checked in to our room on the top floor (10th). While the room was small it was clean, tidy and had all the basics. Tea/coffee/fridge/tv/room safe and a hair dryer what more could you need. The air conditioner was great and very refreshing when coming in from the tropical heat outside. Our bags fitted perfectly on the window ledge and off the floor leaving plenty of room to walk around the queen size bed. We only wanted the room to sleep and shower in so it met all our needs. The bathroom is a little cramped (I'm a heavy build) but there was plenty of room to shower and the water was hot with plenty of pressure. The bed was firm and there were only two thin pillows we didn't need anymore but you could ask for more if you wanted too. The hotel is located 1 minute walk from 15 restaurants in Robertson Quay and a relaxing 10 minutes walk from 30 Clark Quay restaurants. Breakfast was plain fare and the same every day consisting of toast, cereal, omlete or fried eggs, sausage, baked beans, fried rice, tea and coffee at SGN$8, not a bad price considering the cost of a coffee and quiche at a Starbucks. The pool is small but clean and it could do with some more deck chairs, the spa is big enough for 6-8 people but the decore in the gym/spa room was very poor. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful with directions to local attractions. Cabs are remarkably cheap and the MRT is 15 mins walk from the hotel. On the down side because the rooms are small theres no chair to lounge around in. The breakfast area had a couple of comfy chairs to sit in but its a bit far from the room. The shopping center across the road has a supermarket where you can buy booze a bit cheaper than reception and if you walk around the corner past the restaurants there's a dry cleaner thats cheaper than the hotels laundry service. A shopping hint for those new to Singapore, most shops and department store dont open before 10 am. On our last day we checked out with no problems and were able to leave our bags at reception while we went out for our last shopping adventure, upon our return we were offered free use of the Spa/gym showers to freshen up and change into fresh clothes before heading off to the airport. The RQH is a budget hotel with average fittings and we would recommend it to those people who want to spend money on shopping/clubs/food/tours and attractions not the biggest flashest room.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: tek_m_l
Reviews.Content: I've unfortunately stayed at this building twice. The 1st time was because I was still a student and was finding a cheap place with a good location to stay. After that, I reminded myself time and again not to ever come back to this place. However, in January 09 . . my company was trying to cut cost and booked me in this dingy place. I could only endured 1 night and woke up the next morning with a sore neck and a will to get out of that place as fast as I could. I'll try to state some points below: The Average: - The location. It is about 10-15 mins walk to Clark Quay. The BAD: - EVERYTHING ELSE. - The room was extremely small - The bed was extremely hard - The sink is directly infront of the toilet bowl. Imagine the challenge ;) - The carpets were stained and smelly - The staff is extremely unfriendly - Breakfast was stale I'll NEVER return to this place and would not be soo cruel to recommend this sh*thole to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “If you like a small room, then this is for you!!!”
Reviews.Author: PingBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on business. Its quite reasonably priced by Singapore standards. But as the saying goes "you get what you pay for". Its obviously quite an old hotel with dated and not so clean decor and furnishings. But the big eye opener is the size of the rooms. The room was easily the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. If you have a couple suitcases you have to put them on the window ledge or continually step over them moving around the room. No chance of having a queen or king sized bed in the room because they wouldn't fit in the room. After the initial shock of the size of the room I decided to check the bathroom. I've seen cupboards that are bigger! To say they are tiny is a gross understatement. If you are on the large size, I didn't say fat, but read it how ever you like, you will have difficulty especially in the shower, where its tough to turn around without hitting the sides or the door. We only had breakfasts at the hotel, it was included in the tarif so why not. It wasn't too bad, but not real good either. Not much variety of foods and very little western food. We didn't try them for other meals as there are lots of restaurants within a few minutes walk that offer great variety. And Clarke Quay is only 10 minutes walk along the river. All things considered, I wouldn't stay hear again as there are much better hotels at similar tarifs.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Abhijitg299
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and just enough for business person.I have stayed for ten days and found it excellent. The rooms are good and employees are very helpful. I would like to recomment a budget concscious tourist the hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “handy location”
Reviews.Author: angela7
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in an excellent location....very close to the quays for night time dining. The staff are very polite, they provide breakfast and newspapers. This is a small hotel and the price is ok. However the rooms are absolutely tiny. They did however give me a bigger room when I requested one. Overall very good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “good nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandeep68
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a calm and quite surroundings, situated at the shore of quite river flowing across Singapore. The only flaw being VERY SMALL ROOMS and the same breakfast daily. The staff is also not so friendly except a few. The river side restaurant serves good snacks till late in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: THEBOOSydney
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it looked very nice on the internet, the pictures are very deceiving! The room was extremely small, dirty, cleaners refused to clean the room. We had to pay for an extra night because we checked in at 10am but we were told that there's no cleaning service on the day! so why we had to pay an extra FULL PRICE but no cleaning service. Towels not clean, stained.... ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. Staff are not very helpful or considerate. My husband was not well and had the "do not disturb" sign out for a couple of days, and again and again, he got disturbed. So my opinion is, NOT recommended. We travelled around the world for holiday and business, have been staying in different hotels/motels/apartments and this one is absolutely the WORST we have stayed. so DO NOT STAY THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, typical singapore price!”
Reviews.Author: pixie1988
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Round ClarkeQuay is amazing! However it is extremely pricey, but this is the same throughout singapore. This was our first destination and we had booked it from home. It wasn't good value for money as rooms were small and basic but we got TV, hot shower, pretty clean, but there was a off, damp smell throughout entire hotel. No matter where you stay in singapore its pricey. I would look up hostel's in lonely planet. Other backpackers we met got cheaper prices. BEWARE of tax. I thought we were only paying S$120 per/night (which was ridiculously pricey anyway) but then had 15% tax added! this is everywhere, in restaurants, bars EVERYWHERE! compared to rest of SE asia this is pricey. But great place. Singapore is gorgeous, clean, very USA. Dont miss SINGAPORE ZOO!!!

Reviews.Title: “NIghtmare from hell”
Reviews.Author: PeterGod
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore as a party of 5 to celebrate my 60th birthday. There were 2 seperate bookings (3 rooms) as our friends from Ottawa joined us for the occassion. Although we both reviewed the hotel web site let this be a lesson not to believe all you see in pictures. The hotel is tired beyond believe and the rooms so small that you can not both move around at the same time. The hotel staff need basic training in customer service and a wake up call on who is paying their salary. The photos should say it all. Give this one a miss. Thankfully we paid the penalty charges and moved around the corner to the Novotel and received great treatment and superb rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty basic.”
Reviews.Author: bilinki
Reviews.Content: It's in a great location, right on Clarke Quay, which is a pretty up-market area. It was pretty pricey for what you got (which isn't much). It was generally clean. Bit of a musky smell to the hotel. All of Singapore is pricey compared to the rest of Asia so your not really going to get any bargains. It was all you need for a place to sleep & shower.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: temasik
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with the basic amenities that one needs for the night. Don't expect fancy looking building structures and services. It is conveniently located next to Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and a train station. Dining and night spot options are aplenty. We were on the road 14 hours of day while in Singapore. So a basic hotel like Robertson Quay was sufficient for us.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you just need a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: Sophdobe
Reviews.Content: Had to stay over night in singapore for transit and didn't want to spend too much on accomandation as we will only be in the hotel for less than 6hrs. Robertson quay hotel's rate fitted in our budget (Singapore's hotel r expensive!) The room was very small and the bathroom was even smaller (it's more like the size of a public disabled toilet with shower head - there's no shower curtains or anything like that). There's no decor in the room and it looks relatively old. The only advantage of the hotel is its location - it's very close to Clark quay and all the bar/ pub/ club area, so if you r a bit of a party goer and just need somewhere to crash, then this will be the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: carl7Uk
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks fine but it slowly goes down hill fast as you enter. The reception area is very basic that could be so more welcoming. I’ve stayed in a number of low priced hotels around the world but the rooms in this hotel are awful shabby and filthy with no evidence of any attempt to clean them the shower/toilet is a tiny wet room type so when you have a shower the toilet and toilet paper gets wet and you also need to have shoes on if you use the bathroom for the rest or the day because the floor is still wet. The main room walls have stains on them the curtains are filthy and I made the mistake of looking at the pillow under it’s cover and felt a little ill at the condition of it I thought it best not to look at the mattress. Do yourself a favour and spend the extra and avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ricoTeh
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, excellent location and river view. I would strongly recommend this hotel if you travel to singapore. The hotel is very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with my stay”
Reviews.Author: lindylooWestern
Reviews.Content: YES , the staff could do with a "customer improvement course" YES, the rooms are small, shower smaller! HOWEVER! Rooms very clean, wonderful view from my room, 911, very reasonable rates, loved the pool area/ I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “absolute ****hole! avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: BaileyJack
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in and the price is a complete joke. Rooms are so small and dank. Smelt very bed, bathroom was even smaller with cracked tiles, dodgy repair work and mould and mildew everywhere. Thank god I was only there 12 hours. Breakfast is not worth the price of the hotel. Staff in the service areas are very friendly and forthcoming as I'm sure they've had to deal with many complaints. LIke another comment I seriously wouldn't even board my dog here, like the kennel I put her in to go on holiday was five star compared to this.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed for the price”
Reviews.Author: globebird
Reviews.Content: I am throwing my lonely planet in the bin, as it is obvious they just trot out the same old trite from the year before, have they visited this place recently! The staff certainly didn't graduate from the "disney" school of hospitality as it was difficult to raise even a smile from them, the room was small and very tired, I think they had last painted them just before the representative from the Lonely planet visited back in the late 80's. They only provided a top sheet so even in the high of the Singapore summer I managed to freeze my cod's off. They got two things right, the description of the shape of the building and that the location is excellent, but here's hoping that if you planning on staying there that 'you're addicted to base', because it reverbertes through the floor from the bar downstairs on the quay until 1am in the morning. For the money I'd go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back again”
Reviews.Author: omsakti
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 adjoining rooms for S$260 a night. Seemed like a bargain at that time. But when I got to the room, I felt like I made the biggest mistake in my life! The rooms were the smallest I've ever stayed in any hotel in my life. And the shower was ridiculously small. I stayed on the 8th floor. The carpet inside and outside of the rooms smelled as if somebody left some food to rot there and it was never cleaned properly. The breakfast was the same food everyday. Very little choice. The only saving grace was the pool which had a slide, and my kids had a lot of fun with it. Other than that there really is nothing to this hotel that would make me come back again, even for free.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget choice”
Reviews.Author: november_moon
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be a decent budget choice. We happened to be in Singapore during the Singapore Sale and it seems some other things were going on, so hotel rooms rates were high. We chose this hotel based on rate and location. The location was really good (except for the construction mentioned by others - we had a room facing the river and never heard a thing). We had a nice view of the river, which was great, and an easy walk along the river to the MRT station (5-10 minutes). Also buses about a block or so away. Restaurants, bars, and stores close by. Also convinient to Clark and Boat Quay. The hotel itself left some things to be desired, but as a budget choice, it was fine. It was short on amenities, but then we didn't expect them, so we weren't disappointed. We bring our own soap, toothbrush, etc. anyway, so that isn't an issue. Our room had a fridge, which was nice for storing drinks - you can buy bottled and canned drinks in the hotel lobby or at the 7-11 around the corner - and then there is a Cold Storage store about a block away. Breakfast was basic and uninspired, but if all you need is coffee and toast in the morning, it will do fine. The bathroom was tiny - no doubt about that - and I think it would be challenging for tall people to get ready in there. And as mentioned by others, because of the size, the floor and sink get wet when you shower.

Reviews.Title: “My pictures speaks a thousand words...”
Reviews.Author: LUXXX
Reviews.Content: I really needn't speak much about this hotel...it's a shocker! The people were relatively cordial, the location was ok, the rates was on the high side, the breakfast was terrible...but the most noteworthy to speak of is the bathroom. Just see my picture. I was in awe when I saw the size of the bathroom...it's like the size of my grandma's amoire.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't let my dog stay here.........”
Reviews.Author: TheLoudAustralians
Reviews.Content: Where do you start with such a disgusting excuse for a hotel?? After a flight from the UK with 3 kids, we were hoping to get an early check in and to the staff's credit, they allowed us to use the pool while our rooms were being made up. The pool was dated, but the kids appreciated the slide. It went quickly downhill from there. After checking into the rooms, we new we were in trouble when the electricity wasn't working, and the air con was on the fritz (not ideal in 35 degrees and 95% humidity!!!) We had 2 towels between 5 of us, and that was the extent of the "added extras". The mould in the bathroom was thick, and everywhere. The beds were the equivalent of what you may find in the Changi prison, excpet you wouldn't expect the same stains and rips at the jail. We booked in for 2 adults and 3 kids but were presented with 4 beds, when I queried this the reception rushed up a straw mat in a sheet for my youngest - we didn't expect to be "away in a manger" in Singapore............. Originally booked in for 3 nights, we took the cost of the first night on the chin and were staying at the Novotel within 2 hours of checking in. Avoid this hotel at all costs, it's not worth your relationship!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WORST Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: bartman76
Reviews.Content: I had been to many hotels in singapore and this is by far the worst hotel i had seen. Writing a review is difficult as it is so terrible that I just don't know where to begin. First I would not call this a hotel, it is not even a motel it is just a rented room. I made a mistake of booking it for 7 days and pre paid it. If I had not pre paid the room charges I would have move after first day. Ok back to the room. It got nothing. There are just 2 towels and a soap dispenser. NOTHING else not even toothbrush. You would have expect such are basic for any hotel. There are not even any slippers in the room and when I ask the front desk, they answer me in a manner that they do not even bother to look at you when answering you. The room is so small that I would not even call it a room and they only have a 14" TV set which was so out dated. And no bottle water provided too. Honestly this is a first time that I had seen a hotel not providing all this. I had been to 2 stars hotel which is even much better than them Room is dirty and overall it is simply terrible. Even Hotel 81 is much better than them. If you ever want to visit singapore, please do yourself a favor and never go to Robertson Quay Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, small but friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: supernan08
Reviews.Content: This is a very unusually shaped hotel which made space a premium. Our room was clean but a little dated, however, the staff were very helpful, in the main. It is ideal for a stopover but I would find it difficult to manage a full holiday there. Nice to be able to sit by the river in an evening and close to amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering the price”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in room 1009 at Robertson Quay Hotel during one of those weeks when Singapore hotels raise their rates S$50 a night because of high demand. Singapore hotels are getting terribly expensive, making many of us in Jakarta look to taking discount airline flights to Bangkok for medical and other visits. The Robertson Quay hotel room and bathroom are very basic, very small, but adequate and clean. You can't expect amenities such as Kleenex tissue. Water from the shower splashes on the bathroom floor. Plan to be in bare feet when using the toilet or sink, and then you wipe and dry your feet when you leave the bathroom. There are a small writing desk and a stool in the room. The hotel is in an excellent location a block from bus lines on Clemenceau Road that whisk you to Orchard Boulevard/Road and a 10 minute walk from the Clarke Quay MRT station. There are numerous restaurants in the area and a Cold Storage supermarket in UE center a block away. There is construction next door, so ask for a room facing the river. I think that within a few years, the hotel will be replaced with luxury flats or another hotel that is higher than 10 floors. The buffet breakfast is basic, but it includes cereal and milk, boiled, scrambled, fried eggs, and two kinds of bread with butter and jam. The TV had HBO, which was most welcome. We didn’t check into Internet rates. The reception staff are busy but helpful and friendly. The view from room 1009 was very pleasant (see photos).

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: JULIAHOLIDAYS
Reviews.Content: booked with Asia rooms.com this hotel was booked for 1 night for an overnight stay before flying out of singapore. I chose the hotel as it was central for what we wanted and it was close to restaurants and bars. The hotel itself is nice and clean. Our room was very small. It felt like a caravan, but to be fair we had travelled for 2 days on a coach from Thailand before arriving there so it felt very luxurious!! The bathroom was tiny and had a small shower cubical. We were on the 8th floor with a good view of the river - we had double glazed dirty windows so we couldn't see much!! The hotel has a lovely bar at the side of it which is in a beach theme and we had afew cocktails outside on the river and it got pretty busy around 9pm with people walking home from work. You will be amazed by how many western people live in Singapore!!! I would recommend this hotel to people on a budget who are looking for basic accomodation in an easy location. I would also recommend a visit to Sentosa - where the gorgeous luxury hotels are!!!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BrianLew
Reviews.Content: 1) The hotel manager give a speed respond - Good job. 2) We arrived Singapore early and hotel allow us to take bath in the gym and place our luggage in the hotel so that we can have fun later - very good job. 3) The location is wonderful. 5 minute walk to Clark Quay. 10 minute walk along riverside to Clark Quay MRT. 4) Although the room is small, our room has a beautiful city night view. 5) I agreed with others that the toilet design is really small. 6) Basic breakfast. 7) I will choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!....Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandyGuy
Reviews.Content: Booked Online got an okay deal 70 Dollar US a night...Stayed 4 weekdays....Rooms are small but functional for the traveling guy , not looking for luxury...Wouldn't bring wife or kids unless they were "flexible",,,Great location...Near shops-restaurants of Clark and Boat Quay...MRT Station Clarke Quay 10 minute walk...Staff so so...Internet easy in lobby...Tried to charge me 8 dollars for coffee in mourning...Claiming it was breakfast...Gave them 2, told them to deal with it...Had to get extra Blanket...Very thin blankets in room...Good Air Con...Quiet...Still better than Geylang District...But if price was more than 125 SGD wouldn't be worth it...Thanks Randy G

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Ozejim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly terrible. Bad start as they made us wait until 1 pm before we could book into our rooms (arrived at 6 am from our o/n flight). The rooms are the smallest I have ever seen and the bathroom was so small I had to go out into the entrance way to dry myself so I did not bruise my elbows! Breafast lacks any semblance of variety or quality! Only redeeming feature is its location which is fabulous right on the river. Not recommended though!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: chye82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night over the weekend with my girlfriend. It was really disappointing, as both of us has always wanted to check out this hotel. Considering the price of $160 SGD per night, it is considered affordable and the location of the hotel is great. However, once the check in the disappointments start. The room is really small with no much walking space. Next, if you think the room is small wait till you see the toilet! Toilets look really old, and are very small as well. Television is small as well. If you read my other reviews, I am quite a TV junkie. Therefore small television does not score points with me. Breakfast is not impressive, very basic toast, spreads, hard boiled eggs, sausages, baked beans. Very disappointing overall, especially for the price that I am paying for I know that there are better hotels in Singapore at cheaper rates or similar prices. Despite all these negative points, why I gave a 2/5 rating then? The only spark is the location. The hotel is located just opposite Clark Quay and walking distances to many fanciful restaurants in the vicinity. The hotel is perfect for couples who wish to go away for a romantic weekend, but do not have the budget to pay for the other nearby hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: aarghan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean perfect central location. Rooms are a bit small, breakfast so so but at this price I think this is amongst the best place in Singapore. It does not compare with a Pan Pacific or similar but that's a different league. For a 2-3 days stop over it's perfect. For longer I'd choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: rjhempel
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy stay at the Robertson Quay Hotel. I made the booking online, and hoped it was as good as I thought it might be. Not a chance, I had mould in the bathroom, dust and dirt in the room, a leaking ceiling, and despite me telling the staff, nothing was done, and they weren't interested in doing anything about it. All I got was words that they would, and nothing was done, even when I mentioned it at leaving, they weren't interested. It was too much effort for them. They also had building works going on, which they don't inform you about until you are at the hotel, which is simply wrong. The only good thing about this place is the location, but otherwise it was horrid and I wouldn't even give it 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid getting ripped off”
Reviews.Author: pfw1231
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in late October and early November. My plans changed and I canceled one day of my reservation 4 days in advance. They charged my credit card anyway. They do not answer email, and they keep saying "we'll look into it and call you back" when talking on the phone. Terrible customer service. Questionable ethics. I'd avoid this place. I'm still out $120.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel has the friendliest Front Desk!”
Reviews.Author: Wabermenjensen
Reviews.Content: Oh man, i enjoyed my stay there! Front desk guys just gave me a nice smile upon arriving. It was 2nd stay there. I was kinda disappointed that my room is not ready even after 3 pm. But the front desk personnel sorta told me that they are going to be ready in 10 minutes or so. Connection for internet in the room is not so well good... You need to be a rocket scientist to finger out how to solve the configurations. Well i know i am not!. Overall stay was good. I was lost for directions and Front desk seems to know about the way really well!.. Experience huh! I was there recently for the Buddhist convention. I was pleased happy to know one of the front desk personal who has a smiley face. He is a cool chap.. friendly and courteous.. He helped me out when i had trouble with the internet, a chatty guy i must add!. I think he is the only one that understood my accent!. Sadly i forgotten his name which i ask him twice. Bad memory! Anyway Keep up with a good job! A good asset to the management! I would love to visit singapore again.. a nice and warm country..Hopefully to stay and Robertson Quay hotel again!.

Reviews.Title: “No bathtub, only small shower room”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Usa
Reviews.Content: Our room was very small with the basics: a queen-size bed and a TV. The unscreened shower room (no bathrub) has a small sink with a pre-filled liquid soap dispenser, and a toilet. It is still a decent hotel, but I wouldn't give it a 3 star, and I think it might be more suited for backpackers, or anyone who isn't picky. One interesting thing to note is that you need to leave your room cardkey in a slot by the door in your room to turn on the lights. Of course, when you leave the room, you need to take your cardkey with you and it turns the lights in the room off automatically.

Reviews.Title: “Had to leave after first night stay!”
Reviews.Author: pocahontas_78
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience at the Robertson Quay Hotel. I made the booking online, it seemed like good value but boy was I wrong! On arrival the staff were rude, they failed to inform me on booking that there was planned works in the building and as it worked it was on the same floor that I was assigned a room. The room was dirty, the wallpaper was peeled off the wall and the bathroom (if you can call it that) was very dated. I had to leave after the first night stay with the noise from building works and everything else, I found it was not worth staying any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore & great location, with pre-bookable connecting rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LucyKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location and the fact that you can pre-book connecting rooms without waiting until you get there to see if they have allocated you one (I have very rarely come across any other hotels that do this!). The rate is currently $117 for double room or $234 for set of connecting rooms on their website. This is great value for Singapore. The rooms are fairly small (similar size to Traders) as are the bathrooms, but clean enough for a 3 star hotel, it doesnt pretend to be 5 star. We had 3 adults and 2 kids in 2 rooms.Ours also had a fridge, safe, tv hairdryer, internet etc. Its a 5 minute walk to Clarke Quay, with lots of pubs, clubs and restaurants, great for a daytime or evening stroll. They have even developed Robertson Quay itself into a mini Clarke Quay with bars and restaurants on your doorstep. The hotel also has its own bar with deck chairs next to the river and a daily happy hour. Breakfast was basic compared to big hotels, but had coffee, tea, juice, cereals, sausages, beans and eggs, plenty for us and tasted good. Has a small pool with slide going in it, adequate for kids and adults to cool off in. Good value for Singapore and much cheaper than getting 2 rooms in a bigger 4 or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's No Luxury but Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: RaisenFrau
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family (husband and parents) for holidays 4 days. The location is excellent since we had a good view of the Singapore River and part of the Singapore skyline. You can walk to a lot of places. Short walk to some nice bars, cafes and restaurants. For transportation not need to be worry, very easy to get taxi or walk to MRT (only 10-15 min from Hotel). Front desk was very ordinary. As for the reception desk it would be good if they add a smile on their faces whenever they greet or get greet from their hotel guests!! The room is very small, clean and basic. We had a connection room with good view of the Singapore River. We liked it. There was a TV, a telephone, and internet access. Bathroom was small and only had showered. Hot water works very well but be careful sometimes becomes too hot. Breakfast below average, always same menu everyday, they'd soon have to improve it ! Overall we were happy with our stay at Robertson Quay Hotel as a budget choice. We will re-visit someday. Sherly

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: stedan66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days at Robertson Quay Hotel and was satisfied. A little renovation to the rooms should be done, the rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, the interenet connection on room is good and the location is really central (10 min. to China-Town, 15 min. to Orchard Road). The breakfast is a little expensive for what's it, but not 200 meters away is a Delifrance with good coffee and cheap breakfast. All in all the value for price is very good, a real budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: irishtravelfairy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2004 for two separate stints of three nights each. Both times I was really appreciative to have a clean, safe, cool and relaxing place to stay. Overall I found the hotel simple but perfect for my needs. The pool is an added bonus for taking a moonlight dip under the lights of the surrounding skyscrapers - surreal! Don't stay here if you're fussy about cracked tiles and things like that because i'm not......

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with this hotel based on cost.”
Reviews.Author: B&N75
Reviews.Content: For approx £30 a night for a double room with en suite we expected something a lot nice than this place. All very average. Unfriendly and unhelpful staff. The room smelt very damp, it was kind of clean but had a very 'tired' feel to it, not at all nice, very basic. The only good thing about the hotel was the location, you can walk to a lot of places from it but we would never return to the hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: J&GShoreham
Reviews.Content: 2 nights in what I thought was a 3 star hotel. I suggest you do not go by pictures in website or brochures, rather shabby and worn out hotel in desperate need of a clean, modernisation and general revamp. Great rates offered considering it has ok size outside pool but no excuse for general dirty state. Bed was small but compfy but we were not completely relaxed due to linen having worn out discoloured old look/feel plus the headboard was really obviously dirty. Bathroom was disgusting and tiny, they could at least attempt to get rid of the black mould from tiles and shower curtain. Breakfast below average, would rather they quote room only rates and charge for breakfast, they'd soon have to improve it ! Location was good, in front of quiet, prity river location, short walk to some nice bars, cafe's and restaurants. Would not recommend, would suggest pay bit extra.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but good deal”
Reviews.Author: RaboDeToro
Reviews.Content: The Robertson Quay Hotel is a gem in the rough. Unless your idea of a hotel room is somewhere you can sit in an easy chair or sofa while you put your feet up on the coffee table, This place is the place to stay. You couldn't pick a better location in Singapore. It is right on the esplanade along the Singapore River and only a 5 minute walk from the MTR station. It is half the price of other hotels in the same area, and with good reason ... the rooms are very small and basic. Think stateroom, not hotel room. The guy I was traveling with was a fellow retired naval officer. Both of us remarked how much the room reminded us of our staterooms on Navy ships. They had everything you needed and nothing extra. The room was small, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was "compact" but held all the necessities. (don't think free shower caps and hand lotion ... I mean toilet, sink, and shower) There was a TV, a telephone, and internet access. What else do you need? The room comes with included breakfast and only costs $90, a bargain in this area of Singapore. Throw in an extremely helpful staff, and I don't think you could do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: saint28daisy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic weekend in a cute hotel...the size is small, the shape of the room quite irregular & unique. The location is Fantastic since we had a good view of the Singapore river and part of the Singapore skyline. Our room was clean, however, i believe they need to repair the toilet. The breakfast was A okay - more than continental really...quite good and filling...however I ate the same breakfast menu for two mornings. They should learn to change their breakfast menu daily. As for the reception desk, they are all okay and helpful and accommodating. Although it would be good if they add a smile on their faces whenever they greet their hotel guests!! Fantastic Location though very very near the Party Crowd at Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DMMDOMINIQUE
Reviews.Content: Hotel idealy situed bed room ok bath room very small . service ok, the best place is beach bar and this transat at sundown. Breakfast can be improve choice and furniture, stay four nights hot shower evry second day ...

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel:- It does exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Cassiya
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and a dwarf, this is the place for you! The rooms are very very small. Whether it's a Singaporan thing, I didn't like the bathroom/toilet combo. One positive is that it is near Boat & Clarke's Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: skiva
Reviews.Content: We were rather disppointed with our stay at Hotel Robertson and Singapore overall. I was under the assumption that Singapore Hotels were of a 'higher' star rating than those in Europe! Boy, was I wrong. Nothing like the website. The price paid is not worth it, even for a budget hotel and the location is not very convenient. Our room was tiny, the bathroom even tinier, dirty and the decor horrible. We decided to stop in Singapore via Perth from our trip around Europe to relax, hence why we booked a hotel with a pool. This pool looked huge on the website, but when we got up there, boy was it a big let down. It was so small, nothing like the website. The only positive was the breakfast, which was decent enough for the price we paid (for the room). Very disappointing, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had orginally booked three days at this hotel (Feb 2006) however checked out after the first day. Had booked two rooms as was travelling with family of 3 children (11,8, and 4). The rooms were small (similar in size to on site University or college accomadation) fairly tidy but were in need of re-decoration. There were black marks by the air conditioning vents. The bathroom was basicaly a shower and a toilet, mismatching colours. Also has cigarette smoke blowing through the air condioning vents at night. Windows looked dirty and needed cleaning. There was a kettle in each room. One of the rooms had ants crawling over the kettle. This is a room on the 5th floor.There is a pool suitable for infants on the 3rd floor. Would not recommend this hotel. Which is unfortunate as with a bit of paint work and maintenance it could be a nice hotel even though the rooms are small. Ideal for couples and back packers.

Reviews.Title: “cheap but not so cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 12 nights in September. I chose this hotel for the location and price (£29 per night for 2) The rooms were old and tired but bearable. THe rooms had a tv with 1 english channel and a fridge which came in handy! There was no wardrobe or reasonable hanging space for clothes - just a shelf! The bathroom was 'different'. It was a small triangular shape. The shower had no curtain so the entire bathroom flooded, dont bother putting things on shelfs as they just slide off! The pool area was nice but could get busy at times. The location is perfect, right on clarke quay, minutes from restauraunts and the MTR which gets you everywere. All in all for the price it was good value although i personally wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but bearable”
Reviews.Author: gpw68
Reviews.Content: Two nights staying in this hotel was enough. It was a decent base for our short stay although having stayed here before new what to expect. We stayed here mainly for the location which is very good on the river. The rooms were clean, but the bathroom belongs in a prison with the sink over hanging the toilet, although the shower is ok and washes the floor at the same time due to there being no shower curtain! Also included in our room price was a buffet breakfast which was ok. They are doing renovation on the outside of the hotel at the moment but we did not notice this. The rooms are very cheap and ours included a buffet breakfast. We got what we paid for, a budget hotel for a budget price.
